I was curious to see a debate among us about two interesting contradictions based on abortion. First, abortion is cutting off the life of a living fetus that is completely innocent and yet, most pro-choice advocates are completely against capital punishment, ending the life of a murderer. Second, don't liberals tend to often accuse conservatives of trying to play god? But when it comes to abortion, are they not playing god by saying when the human life begins and where? I'm just interested in seeing some different opinions on these conspicuous contradictions.

 rhet·o·ric ** *P***Pronunciation Key**(rtr-k)
 n. The art or study of using language effectively and persuasively.
 A treatise or book discussing this art.
 
 Skill in using language effectively and persuasively.
 A style of speaking or writing, especially the language of a particular subject: fiery political rhetoric. 
 Language that is elaborate, pretentious, insincere, or intellectually vacuous: His offers of compromise were mere rhetoric. 
 
 Verbal communication; discourse.
 http://dictionary.reference.com/search?q=rhetoric
